tossups.question: This artist names a wooden staircase incorporating Super 8 recorded black and white video, that Fluxus series was created by Shigeko Kubota. Raymond Roussel’s Impressions of Africa influenced a collection of notes this artist included in one of his portable artworks. This artist of several “Rotoreliefs” suggested the name “mobiles” to Alexander Calder and replaced the word “violet” with “veil” on a Rigaud perfume bottle depicting himself. This artist of a Boite-en-valise created a (*) peephole through which a nude woman holding a lamp can be seen. This artist of Étant donnés (“AY-tunt don-AY”) quit art to play chess in Buenos Aires. He used a piece of tape for the vulgar expression L.H.O.O.Q. that he included along with the goatee and mustache on a postcard of the Mona Lisa. For 10 points, Rrose Selavy (“air-rose say-lah-vee”) was the alter ego of what artist whose readymades include Fountain?

A recent Nature paper by McAlpine et al. described how chronic fragmentation of this process increases hematopoietic progenitor cells and decreases hypothalamic hypocretin. It’s not Creutzfeld-Jacob disease, but patients with an aspartic acid to asparagine mutation in position 178 of PRNP are unable to undergo this process. One region that regulates this process is rich in cells that predominantly express c-fos and release inhibitory neurotransmitters galanin and GABA; that structure is the (*) ventrolateral preoptic nucleus. Approximately 75% of human growth hormone is released while a person is undergoing this process. One phase of this process is characterized by rapid hippocampal theta waves and fast, irregular eye motions, and this process is typically accompanied by increased secretion of melatonin by the pineal gland. For 10 points, name this process during which humans dream.
tossups.answer: sleep [or rapid eye movement sleep; or REM sleep; or non rapid-eye movement sleep; or NREM sleep; or word forms; prompt on dreaming]
tossups.answer_formatted: sleep [or rapid eye movement sleep; or REM sleep; or non rapid-eye movement sleep; or NREM sleep; or word forms; prompt on dreaming]

tossups.question: Description acceptable. In a short story named for one of these places, the narrator had to step into a closet and “perform [his] Hatred Abatement Breathing”; that narrator is asked how a gang can be a “Teen Group without an adult mentor with a special skill like whittling?” In another work, Kiwi makes friends with Vijay at one of these places called The World of Darkness. A man in one of these places leaves a severed hand on a desk and calls himself “the Rectifier.” Osceola elopes with a ghost and Ava is raped by the (*) Bird Man in a novel by Karen Russell named after one of these places. Samuel is hired to fight gangs but kills the narrator in one of these locations in a George Saunders work. Swamplandia! and CivilWarland in Bad Decline are both set in these locations. For 10 points, name these places, the subject of Cory Doctorow’s Down and Out in the Magic Kingdom.
tossups.answer: theme parks [or amusement parks; accept equivalents]

tossups.question: The journalist Malcolm Caldwell was murdered shortly after meeting this man, of whom Caldwell was a staunch supporter. This man professed that he had made “mistakes” but his “conscience was clear” in an interview with Nate Thayer. Dissidents like Pen Sovan founded FUNSK to overthrow this man. This man classified bibliophiles and the bespectacled as “depositees” and purged (*) “New People” who did not have a place in Year Zero. A memorial at Choeung Ek commemorates the victims of this man, as does a museum in the former site of the S-21 prison. Soldiers bludgeoned rather than shot victims in this man’s “Killing Fields” to save scarce bullets. For 10 points, name this communist who led the Khmer Rouge and carried out the Cambodian Genocide.

St. Peter Damian called the ninth Pope with this name “a demon from hell” because of his sexual scandals; that Pope was expelled from Rome twice and was a member of the Theophylact family who also produced the 7th and 8th popes with this name. A Pope with this name served throughout World War I, while a saint with this name was legendarily prevented from leaving the residence of his sister, St. (*) Scholastica, by intense thunderstorms. That saint survived an assassination attempt when a cup of poison was shattered by the sign of the cross. The encyclical “God is love” was written by a pope with this name who abruptly resigned from office in 2013. “Prayer and work” is the motto of an order founded by a saint with this name from Nursia. Pope Francis was preceded by the 16th Pope with, for 10 points, what name?

bonuses.leadin: The German roots of this art movement partly trace back to Anselm Kiefer and Georg Baselitz’ contributions to the 1980 Venice Biennale. For 10 points each:
answers: Neo-expressionism [or Junge Wilde or Neue Wilden in Germany; or Transavantgarde or Transavanguardia in Italy]
parts: Name this 1980s art movement that emphasized gesturalism as a response to the glut of conceptual art. In America, it was represented by Eric Fischl’s depictions of suburbia and Julian Schnabel’s plate paintings.

Julian Schnabel also directed a documentary about this fellow Neo-expressionist street artist, who began his career as part of the duo SAMO (“SAME-oh”) in New York and later collaborated with Andy Warhol and Keith Haring.
Basquiat’s Neo-expressionist style was influenced by his early career using this medium, also used by Banksy for his satirical and often stenciled street art.
answers_formatted: Neo-expressionism [or Junge Wilde or Neue Wilden in Germany; or Transavantgarde or Transavanguardia in Italy]

bonuses.leadin: One of these constructs can be duplicated and translated to fill all of space. For 10 points each:
answers: unit cells [accept primitive cells; prompt on cells]
parts: Name these constructs which are the smallest repeating sections of a crystal. A simple cubic crystal has the equivalent of one atom packed into every one of these, while a body-centered cubic has two.

In a perfect cubic crystal, there are three planes which run parallel to one axis of a unit cell but intersect the other two at 45 degrees. Name any of those three planes, expressing your answer in reduced Miller indices.

The unit cells with the highest packing efficiency are the face-centered cubic and a “close-packed” one where the top and bottom of the cell have this shape. Lonsdaleite and wurtzite have lattices with this shape.

bonuses.leadin: After this country’s King Simeon II was deposed by the Soviets, he returned in 1996 and successfully ran for Prime Minister, for 10 points:
parts: Name this Black Sea country whose feared Committee for State Security assisted in the assassination of dissident writer Georgi Markov with a ricin-tipped umbrella. Simeon II briefly ruled this country from Sofia.

This Bulgarian leader ordered the assassination of Georgi Markov. The longest-serving Eastern Bloc leader, this man forced Turks to take Bulgarian names and encouraged subordinates to practice predanost.

This father of Simeon II recovered Bulgarian losses in the Treaty of Neuilly by allying with the Axis. Ministers such as Dimitar Peshev and Exarch Stephen pressured him to rescue Bulgarian Jews from deportation to the Holocaust.

bonuses.leadin: For 10 points each, answer the following about elements of a controlled experiment.
parts: This type of effect occurs to those in the control group of an experiment. Participants improve despite receiving a fake version of the treatment.
For people in an experiment, learning that they are in an experiment could cause this type of effect, whereby expected results are altered due to participants knowing that they are being monitored.

In experiments where samples might not have been chosen randomly, this statistical technique is used to correct the bias by combining the sampling probability of each observation with the conditional expectation of the dependent variable.

bonuses.leadin: Many computer science concepts are named for cultural references. For 10 points each:
answers: little-endian or big-endian or endianness [prompt on LSB or MSB]
parts: Guido van Rossum named this whitespace-using, dynamically typed language after an absurdist British comedy troupe. It is frequently used for its "num" and "sci" libraries.
This Python library for web scraping is an HTML/XML parser designed to work even with malformed data. It is named for a song sung by the Mock Turtle in Alice in Wonderland.

This concept, the ordering of bytes within a multi-byte number, comes in two types: putting the least significant byte or the most significant byte first. It is named for two factions who war over the best way to break eggs in Gulliver's Travels.
answers_formatted: little-endian or big-endian or endianness [prompt on LSB or MSB]
